content: this argyle sweater vest combines cables and lace for a modern take on a classic style a perfect addition to your preppy summer wardrobe note this is an advanced level knitting pattern you will need to know how to work cables and lace stitches and feel confident following cable charts this sweater vest is worked from bottom up main body piece will be knit in the round front and back pieces will be worked flat and then joined at the shoulders stitches will be picked up around the neckline and arm openings to work ribbing a free version of this pattern can be viewed on my blog 2 this sweater is designed in 9 sizes xs s m l xl 2x 3x 4x 5x finished bust/chest circumference 36 40 44 48 52 56 60 64 68 finished length 25 25 25 26 25 26 25 26 25 27 25 27 25 27 25 this sweater is designed to be worn with 6-8 of positive ease model is 6 tall has a 33 bust and is wearing a size small with 7 of positive ease for best fit choose a size that is closest to 6-8 larger than your corresponding bust measurement for example if your bust is 50 you would wear a size 2x if you prefer your garments to fit looser or more snug choose a size with less or more ease accordingly materials 3 3 4 4 4 5 5 5 6 skeins / approx 696 696 928 928 928 1160 1160 1160 1392 yards lion brand coboo yarn shown in olive size us 6 4 0 mm circular knitting needles for ribbing side us 7 4 5 mm circular knitting needles for body cable needle stitch markers stitch holder or scrap yarn tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge 18 stitches and 30 row = 4 in argyle cable motif on size 7 needles this pattern is written in us english terms this pattern and photographs of this garment are property of kaitlin barthold of originally lovely this pattern photos and design are subject to copyright and are for personal use only all commercial use is strictly prohibited you may not produce or distribute this pattern under any circumstances 2 https //www originallylovely com/knitting/argyle-sweater-vest-knitting-pattern/
